publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3300 Rhona Brankin: 2002 Commonwealth Gamesâ€”That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish team on its tremendous performance in winning 30 medals at the 2002 Commonwealth Games in Manchester; welcomes the support for the team from the Scottish Executive and the National Lottery through sportscotland and the Scottish Institute of Sport; recognises the importance of sport in shaping a healthier Scotland and, following the successful hosting of the games by Manchester, notes the potential benefits of staging major sporting events in Scotland such as the European Football Championships in 2008 and the Ryder Cup. Supported by: Robin Harper*

S1M-3300 2002 Commonwealth Games (lodged on 5 August 2002) Mr Tom McCabe*, Nora Radcliffe*, Iain Smith*, Trish Godman*, Sarah Boyack*, Janis Hughes*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Maureen Macmillan*, Irene Oldfather*, Elaine Thomson*, Margaret Jamieson*, Cathie Craigie*, Tavish Scott*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Helen Eadie*
S1M-3300 2002 Commonwealth Games (lodged on 5 August 2002) Bill Butler*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-3300 2002 Commonwealth Games (lodged on 5 August 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3300 2002 Commonwealth Games (lodged on 5 August 2002) Angus MacKay*
S1M-3300 2002 Commonwealth Games (lodged on 5 August 2002) Karen Gillon*
S1M-3300 2002 Commonwealth Games (lodged on 5 August 2002) Scott Barrie*, Marilyn Livingstone*
